result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner J Kratochvil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by the agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
1 day credit if revoked.
If defendant meets all requirements of probation conditions my have early discharge of probation at agent's discretion.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanner J Kratochvil

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:47pm
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Deft appears with Atty Anne Renc.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Possession of methamphetamine >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
Atty Renc asks court for early release of probation after 6 months of successful completion of all programming by DOJ
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. If revoked, 1 day credit granted. If deft does meet all requirements of probation conditions, at probation agents discrection if early discharge is approved. 

Adj: 1:58pm
Plea hearing on May 2, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed mirroring criminal complaint by end of business day.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Dates already set.
